thread.title: Happy International Women's Day 2017! 7 most inspiring famous women in history and 10 most empowering books to read
thread.title_full: Happy International Women's Day 2017! 7 most inspiring famous women in history and 10 most empowering books to read

author: Chantelle Symester
title: Happy International Women's Day 2017! 7 most inspiring famous women in history and 10 most empowering books to read
text:
News Happy International Women's Day 2017! 7 most inspiring famous women in history and 10 most empowering books to read It's the day when we celebrate women, big or small, but who deserves the title as the most inspirational woman of all time? Share The late Princess Diana topped the list (Photo: PA) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Today marks International Women's Day 2017 , when the world celebrates female achievement and highlights the plight of global women's issues. 
Unsurprisingly, a UK poll revealed 48% of women believe their mothers are the most inspiring woman they know. 
The study also showed that the majority of us agree that this decade is the best time to be a women - and we couldn't agree more. But which women topped the list as the most inspiring of the last seven decades? Read More Female pioneers celebrated as women urged to #BeBoldForChange 
A study, commissioned by Foxy Bingo, reveals the late Princess Diana has the title of 'most inspirational woman of all time', ahead of formidable female figures in history like Britain's first female Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher. 
Here's a breakdown of some of the most influential women of each decade over the last 70 years. 1950s - Rosa Parks 1955 Rosa Parks mugshot 
In 1955 Rosa Parks prompts the Montgomery bus boycott and becomes "the first lady of civil rights" in America. 1960s - Twiggy Twiggy in 1967 (Photo: Getty) 
The poster child of the swinging sixties, Twiggy became the world's first supermodel, and a cultural icon of the changing times and fashions in Britain. Read More International Women's Day 2017 news 1970s - Germaine Greer Australian writer and journalist Germaine Greer in a photoshoot for the satirical underground magazine 'Oz', UK, March 1969 (Photo: Redferns) 
Germaine Greer's seminal work 'The Female Enuch', published in 1970, became a watershed moment for the feminist movement and an international besteller. 1980s - Princess Diana Princess Diana has been celebrated worldwide for her charity work (Photo: PA) 
A woman who needs no introduction is Princess Diana, dubbed the people's Princess, she is known and celebrated worldwide for her humanitarian work for a number of causes. 1990s - The Spice Girls The Spice Girls popularised girl power back in the 90s (Photo: Getty) 
Girl power became cool when the Spice Girls burst onto the pop scene in the 90s, paving the way for modern day pop singers like Adele (yes, she's a fan). 2000s - JK Rowling J.K. Rowling is one of the most successful authors of all time (Photo: Cindy Ord/Getty Images) 
She's sold millions of books worldwide and created one of the most well loved fictional characters of all time. 2010s - Malala Yousafzai Malala Yousafzai was awarded the Nobel Peace prize for her work fighting for women's rights (Photo: Getty) 
A young woman who has overcome tragedy and terror, at the tender of age of 17 Malala was awarded the Nobel Peace prize for her work as an activist for women's rights around the world. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
